channel.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
channel.description:
Okay so, since this is general questions section, I think I'm posting this in the right section..
I've got a very good laptop, but I fear it might need some upgrades/changes. What do you recommend?
Just to let you know, I want my laptop to run games like FIFA14 and Battlefield 4 smoothly without any lag/freezes, I don't mind reducing the quality though, I have ABSOLUTELY no knowledge in these stuff, so I decided to ask you guys..
I got keyboard, mouse things covered.
Here are some information anyway:
Product name: HP Pavilion dv6 Notebook PC Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit Service Pack 1 System memory (RAM): 8GB Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-2670QM CPU @ 2.20GHz 2.20 GHz (It's a dual core or something) System type: 64-bit Operating System
Graphics device 1: Intel(R) HD Graphics Family Current resolution 1366 x 768 Refresh rate 60
Graphics device 2: AMD Radeon 6700M Series
Video card: AMD Radeon HD 6700M Series Chop Type: ATI display adaprter (0x6740) Dac Type: Internal DAC (400MHz) Approx. Total Memory: 4095 MB Current Display Mode: 1366 x 768 (32 bit) (60 Hz) Monitor: Generic PnP Monitor
If you needed anything else please reply.
Please tell me what exactly should I upgrade, and tell me what you recommend. :)
Thanks!

item.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:33, topic:528289”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=647037.msg4355841#msg4355841 date=1377555001]

amazon.com

Amazon.com: HP PAVILION P2-1334 Desktop PC AMD E1-1200 1.4GHz Processor, 4GB Ram, 500Gb Hard Drive, Windows 8 (Black): Computers & Accessories

The operating system on this desktop is Windows 10 and it is freshly installed with all basic software needed, free anti-virus and office suite! This listing is for the desktop only, NO accessories in ...

bought this piece of shit desktop at best buy for 300 bucks. runs games like skyrim and nba 2k13 just fine on low settings.

it’s all i could afford, but if you really don’t care about looking at pixelated textures while you play then this is a good bet. Looks like you could get a used one on Amazon for ~$250.
[/quote]should be able to get best buy to price match and if you complain enough they will even give you a $20 card ;)[/quote]

yeah looks like i should’ve done some more research lol

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @N_A_W_R_A_S N A W R A S
item.description:
@N_A_W_R_A_S wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:29, topic:528289”][quote author=N A W R A S link=topic=647037.msg4352528#msg4352528 date=1376921423]

That doesn’t matter. How much dedicated video memory do you have?

I have 4095 Approx. Video memory(dxdiag). And 8 GB install RAM(computer properties).
[/quote]doesn’t mean anything… you could have a gt 640 with 3-4 gb of dedicated memory but it still is going to be crap.

If you want the best, you have to buy the newest/best stuff.[/quote]

Oh well…

item.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“N A W R A S, post:25, topic:528289”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=647037.msg4352098#msg4352098 date=1376837150]
Unfortunately most laptops you cannot upgrade the GPU. Just look up how much video memory you have and play games within that range. Standard newer laptops usually only come with little video memory (less than 1gb)
[/quote]

What do you mean by playing games within that range? I have 4095 mb video memory btw.

if you have a relative or a friend or something like that in sweden, you could always buy one of these
http://translate.google.fi/translate?sl=sv&tl=en&js=n&prev=t&hl=en&ie=UTF-8&u=http%3A%2F%2Fcdon.se%2Fhemelektronik%2Fspeldatorer-_thor%2F
they’re breddy good for the price

I wish I had someone living there then
Keep in mind I DON’T WANT TO BUY A NEW LAPTOP/PC, I’m in a situation where I can’t buy a new desktop for gaming, I can only upgrade my laptop, believe it or not. But I guess I’m screwed, aren’t I? :([/quote]

That doesn’t matter. How much dedicated video memory do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
item.dc:creator: @N_A_W_R_A_S N A W R A S
item.description:
@N_A_W_R_A_S wrote:

Muroth:

Aren’t desktops cheaper than laptops? Look for refurbished laptop deals

Yup desktops are for sure cheaper than laptops.
I’m currently in a situation where I can’t buy a new desktop as there is no place for it in my room (my room is kinda small and shared which is lame lol).
If you can tell me what parts I should change/upgrade, I will be grateful

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:528289”][quote author=Muroth link=topic=647037.msg4351891#msg4351891 date=1376792645]
Aren’t desktops cheaper than laptops? Look for refurbished laptop deals
[/quote]
They can be cheaper for the same specs…
@OP
Click here for a perfect laptop for you[/quote]

LOL

[quote=“Muroth, post:18, topic:528289”]http://outlet.lenovo.com/SEUILibrary/controller/e/outlet_us/LenovoPortal/en_US/catalog.workflow:item.detail?GroupID=445&Code=59RF0020 $220 decent laptop

edit: You won’t get a good gaming laptop unless you’re willing to spend quite a bit of money. What’s your budget?[/quote]

Don’t mind the budget, all what I want you guys is to tell me what parts that I need to change/upgrade.

[quote=“Frell, post:19, topic:528289”][quote author=N A W R A S link=topic=647037.msg4351680#msg4351680 date=1376763576]
So… Any other suggestions/recommendations?
[/quote]
Yes

get a desktop, youll save tons and you can upgrade it forever[/quote]

Well, I’m currently considering it…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxx123xxx xxx123xxx
item.description:
@xxx123xxx wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:13, topic:528289”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=647037.msg4351300#msg4351300 date=1376686688]
A little offtopic

Aren’t there upgradable laptops floating around? I knew a guy who had gaming laptop from MSI, swapped out the CPU + GPU iirc
[/quote]
Are you talking about Clevo laptops? Those laptops are bareboned and you can usually find kits and build it to your liking. But keep in mind although build your own, the parts don’t come cheap[/quote]
Never heard about Clevo before, will definitely check them out. Thanks for the info dude

item.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
item.dc:creator: @N_A_W_R_A_S N A W R A S
item.description:
@N_A_W_R_A_S wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:11, topic:528289”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=647037.msg4351300#msg4351300 date=1376686688]
A little offtopic

Aren’t there upgradable laptops floating around? I knew a guy who had gaming laptop from MSI, swapped out the CPU + GPU iirc
[/quote]
Very few are, but his definitely isn’t.[/quote]

Unfortunately…
Well a friend told me to upgrade the video card, it should do well on low settings of games, what do you reckon guys?
EDIT:
I was surfing around, then I found this line:

The CPU can be changed as long as you buy another one with same socket and FSB.

Read full topic
item.source: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]

item.title: Gaming laptop [I Seriously need your recommendations ..]
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:10, topic:528289”]A little offtopic

Aren’t there upgradable laptops floating around? I knew a guy who had gaming laptop from MSI, swapped out the CPU + GPU iirc[/quote]
Very few are, but his definitely isn’t.

Edit: Should point out the CPU is replaceable on almost everything, but it does involve tearing the thing apart and making sure a lot of factors match the original CPU

Read full topic
